doc.title: Italian charm: Silvio Berlusconi's history of gaffes
doc.author: Guardian Staff; Guardian staff reporter
doc.description: Italian prime minister adds to his catalogue of impolitic behaviour at the G20 and Nato summits

main.p: The Italian prime minister was so anxious to finish a conversation on his mobile phone yesterday that he waved away Angela Merkel, the German chancellor, as she waited to greet him at the start of the Nato summit.

At Buckingham Palace last Thursday, the Queen expressed irritation with the Italian leader as he posed for the group photograph at end of the G20 summit. "What is it? Why does he have to shout?" she asked as Berlusconi called out to Barack Obama, who was standing behind her at the time.
In Trieste in November last year, Berlusconi appeared to play hide and seek with Merkel, ducking out of sight behind a column.
